result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin M. Shook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with victim A.A. or his business.
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
No contact with co-actors: Andrew Wilbur, Nathan Boettcher, Kristopher Gindt.

Defendant to submit to random testing
Submit to DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with programming and assessments as directed by the Dept. of Corrections.
Court sets restitution at $0.00

Court costs paid in full from bond posted (balance returned to poster)
Pay supervision fees.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
No contact with firearms; weapons, ammunition

Defendant Dustin M. Shook in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties in receipt of PSI. State gives recommendation. Statement by family member. Statement by defense counsel. Court renders sentence.
Sentencing hearing on March 26, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Clerk confirmed availability with Atty Last for adjourned sentencing date of 3/26/15 at 2pm. Notices mailed.
Copies of PSI distributed. Copy mailed to Attorney Last, emailed to District Attorney's Office and provided to Branch 3 for review.

1/20/2015 Trial
  Paper exhibits destroyed as of 07/07/2020.
Court's voir dire
Preliminary jury instructions by the Court

Defendant Dustin Shook appears with Atty Matt Last. Adam Y. Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury panel brought in and given oath. 
20 jurors called to box. 
Voir dire by the Court. 
Voir dire by the State.
Voir dire by the Defense.
9:35am Jury striking by parties. 
9:40am 12 jurors selected with reamining panel thanked and excused. 
9:41am Oath given to jury to try case. Court gives preliminary instructions
9:55am Court in recess  
10:15am Jury brought in. Opening statement by the State.
10:28am Opening statment by Defense.
10:35am A.A. sworn and testified.
10:50am A.W. sworn and testified.
11:05am H.P. sworn and testified.
11:18am Officer M. Brandenmuehl
11:23am Jury excused.  Statement by parties outside jury's presence. Atty Alme-Boaz now present in court with her client N.B.
11:25am N.B. sworn and questioned outside the presence of the jury.
11:33am Jury returns
11:34am N.B. sworn and testified.
12:03pm Officer L. Wegner sworn and testified. State rests. 
12:13pm Jury excused. Court to resume at 1:30pm.  
1:38pm  Back in session, outside the presence of the jury. Same appearances. Collequey with defendant regarding testifying. Defense makes motion to dismiss without argument. Court denies request based on testimony given
1:44pm Jury brought in.
1:45pm Defendant sworn and testified. 
2:13pm Continued testimony of Officer L. Wegner. 
2:20pm Jury conference held outside the presence of the jury.
3:02pm Jury brought in. Court reads jury instructions.
3:12pm Closing statement by the State.
3:29pm Closing statement by Defense.
3:41pm Rebuttal by the State.
3:48pm Final instructions given by the Court.
3:52pm Jury out for deliberation.

4:40pm  Court/counsel/defendant/ jury in court. Jury has a question.
               Court permits exhibits #2, 3 & 4 to be given to jury. 
5:10pm Court is informed a verdict has been reached.
5:18pm Court/counsel/defendant/jury in court. Verdict read: Guilty  Question: Yes
               State moves for judgment on the verdict. Defense moves for judgment not withstanding the verdict.
5:22pm Jury thanked and excused. 
5:23pm Court grants judgment on the verdict. Court orders a presentence investigation be completed. Defendant remanded into custody.
               Court adjourns sentencing to 3/10/2015 at 1:00 pm.

Defendant Dustin M. Shook in court with attorney Matt Last.  ADA Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Last filed severance motion. State does not object. Court grants motion. Statement by Atty Sisley. Case to be recalled at 10:00 am. 11:04 am/Case recalled with same appearances with Attorney Adam Gerol for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Last requests to proceed to jury trial. Court reviews motion in limine with counsel. Jury trial to proceed on January 20, 2015 as to Dustin Shook only.

Defendant Dustin M. Shook in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel has received discovery and pretrial set for 10/24/14. Counsel requests to be heard on reduction of bail. State objects. Court denies request  Further proceedings scheduled for November 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.

State appears by Attorney Gerol. Defendant in custody appearing by video from Ozaukee County Jail. Attorney Matt Last appears by telephone. Counsel waives reading. State requests $10,000 cash bond. Court orders $5,000 cash bail with same conditions. Court orders that the $1,000 is reinstated so defendant to post an additional $4000 in order to be released. Further proceedings scheduled for 10-08-14 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Dustin M. Shook in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver form filed. Court examines defendant, accepts said waiver and binds matter over for trial. State informs. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea. Bail motion heard. State objects to reduction of cash bail.  Further proceedings scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

State by DA Adam Gerol. Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Alme Boaz.  Counsel advises the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation due to his employment.  Counsel waives reading.  Court finds probable cause.  State requesting $10,000 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $1500 cash bail w/conditions:  No contact with the A. Residence on Bonniwell in Mequon WI; no contact with co-defendant Nathaniel Boettcher.  Court examines defendant on right to preliminary hearing and right to counsel.  Court finds good cause to extend timelimits for holding of the preliminary hearing and orders matter adj to 8/14 at 10 am for status of prelim hrg.
